thread.title: Tokyo stocks erase 2015 gains on China fears
thread.title_full: Tokyo stocks erase 2015 gains on China fears | Business Spectator

author: Dow Jones newswires
title: Tokyo stocks erase 2015 gains on China fears
text:
Japanese stocks fell to a seven-month low on Tuesday after weak trade data out of China stoked concerns about a further slowdown in the world's second-largest economy.
The Nikkei Stock Average fell 433.39 points, or 2.4 per cent, to 17427.08, its lowest level since February 3. The Japanese benchmark erased all gains made in 2015.
Concerns about China's economy and uncertainty over the US Federal Reserve's policy outlook continued to dominate trading themes. Japanese stocks extended falls in afternoon trading after weaker-than-expected Chinese trade data.
Japanese stocks linked to demand from China and foreign tourists lost ground. Chemical and cosmetics firm Kao Corp fell 4.2 per cent to 4,965 yen ($US41.61). Retail-store operator Seven & I Holdings Co dropped 4.1 per cent to Y4,763.
Some market participants said investors who tend to buy growth-oriented stocks are likely liquidating some of their positions.
The US policy outlook remains uncertain at least until the Federal Open Market Committee meets on Sept. 16-17. While speculation is growing that the Federal Reserve won't raise interest rates this month because inflation remains low, some market participants aren't convinced.
"You don't know until the meeting is over," said Yusuke Sakai, a senior stock trader at T&D Asset Management Co.
The sale of Japanese stocks by foreigners in August, at Y1.4 trillion ($US11.73 billion), was the biggest since August 2011, finance ministry data showed on Tuesday. The purchase of Y52.1 trillion in stocks and the sale of Y53.6 trillion in stocks were also each the highest level since the data became available in 2005.
